00034 /** @file decl.cpp
00035     @brief Implementations of classes related to turning declarations into 
00036            symbols and types.
00037 */

00039 #include "decl.h"

00046 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00047 // DeclSpecs
00048 
00049 DeclSpecs::DeclSpecs(const Type *t, StorageClass sc, int tq) {
00050     baseType = t;
00051     storageClass = sc;
00052     typeQualifier = tq;
00053     soaWidth = 0;
00054     vectorSize = 0;
00055 }
00056 
00057 
00058 void
00059 DeclSpecs::Print() const {
00060     if (storageClass == SC_EXTERN)   printf("extern ");
00061     if (storageClass == SC_EXTERN_C) printf("extern \"C\" ");
00062     if (storageClass == SC_EXPORT)   printf("export ");
00063     if (storageClass == SC_STATIC)   printf("static ");
00064     if (storageClass == SC_TYPEDEF)  printf("typedef ");
00065 
00066     if (soaWidth > 0) printf("soa<%d> ", soaWidth);
00067 
00068     if (typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_INLINE)    printf("inline ");
00069     if (typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_CONST)     printf("const ");
00070     if (typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM)   printf("uniform ");
00071     if (typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_VARYING)   printf("varying ");
00072     if (typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_TASK)      printf("task ");
00073     if (typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_REFERENCE) printf("reference ");
00074     if (typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_UNSIGNED)  printf("unsigned ");
00075 
00076     printf("%s", baseType->GetString().c_str());
00077 
00078     if (vectorSize > 0) printf("<%d>", vectorSize);
00079 }

00085 Declarator::Declarator(Symbol *s, SourcePos p) 
00086   : pos(p) { 
00087     sym = s;
00088     functionArgs = NULL;
00089     isFunction = false;
00090     initExpr = NULL;
00091 }

00093 
00094 void
00095 Declarator::AddArrayDimension(int size) {
00096     assert(size > 0 || size == -1); // -1 -> unsized
00097     arraySize.push_back(size);
00098 }

00100 
00101 void
00102 Declarator::InitFromDeclSpecs(DeclSpecs *ds) {
00103     sym->type = GetType(ds);
00104 
00105     if (ds->storageClass == SC_STATIC)
00106         sym->isStatic = true;
00107 }

00109 
00110 void
00111 Declarator::Print() const {
00112     printf("%s", sym->name.c_str());
00113     if (initExpr != NULL) {
00114         printf(" = (");
00115         initExpr->Print();
00116         printf(")");
00117     }
00118     pos.Print();
00119 }

00121 
00122 static const Type *
00123 lGetType(const Declarator *decl, DeclSpecs *ds, 
00124          std::vector<int>::const_iterator arrayIter) {
00125     if (arrayIter == decl->arraySize.end()) {
00126         // If we don't have an array (or have processed all of the array
00127         // dimensions in previous recursive calls), we can go ahead and
00128         // figure out the final non-array type we have here.
00129         const Type *type = ds->baseType;
00130         if (type == NULL) {
00131             Error(decl->pos, "Type not provided in variable declaration for variable \"%s\".",
00132                   decl->sym->name.c_str());
00133             return NULL;
00134         }
00135 
00136         // Account for 'unsigned' and 'const' qualifiers in the type
00137         if ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_UNSIGNED) != 0) {
00138             const Type *unsignedType = type->GetAsUnsignedType();
00139             if (unsignedType != NULL)
00140                 type = unsignedType;
00141             else
00142                 Error(decl->pos, "\"unsigned\" qualifier is illegal with \"%s\" type.",
00143                       type->GetString().c_str());
00144         }
00145         if ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_CONST) != 0)
00146             type = type->GetAsConstType();
00147 
00148         if (ds->vectorSize > 0) {
00149             const AtomicType *atomicType = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type);
00150             if (atomicType == NULL) {
00151                 Error(decl->pos, "Only atomic types (int, float, ...) are legal for vector "
00152                       "types.");
00153                 return NULL;
00154             }
00155             type = new VectorType(atomicType, ds->vectorSize);
00156         }
00157 
00158         // if uniform/varying is specified explicitly, then go with that
00159         if ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM) != 0)
00160             return type->GetAsUniformType();
00161         else if ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_VARYING) != 0)
00162             return type->GetAsVaryingType();
00163         else {
00164             // otherwise, structs are uniform by default and everything
00165             // else is varying by default
00166             if (dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(type) != NULL)
00167                 return type->GetAsUniformType();
00168             else
00169                 return type->GetAsVaryingType();
00170         }
00171     }
00172     else {
00173         // Peel off one dimension of the array
00174         int arraySize = *arrayIter;
00175         ++arrayIter;
00176 
00177         // Get the type, not including the arraySize dimension peeled off
00178         // above.
00179         const Type *childType = lGetType(decl, ds, arrayIter);
00180 
00181         int soaWidth = ds->soaWidth;
00182         if (soaWidth == 0)
00183             // If there's no "soa<n>" stuff going on, just return a regular
00184             // array with the appropriate size 
00185             return new ArrayType(childType, arraySize == -1 ? 0 : arraySize);
00186        else {
00187             // Make sure we actually have an array of structs ..
00188             const StructType *childStructType = 
00189                 dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(childType);
00190             if (childStructType == NULL) {
00191                 Error(decl->pos, "Illegal to provide soa<%d> qualifier with non-struct "
00192                       "type \"%s\".", soaWidth, childType->GetString().c_str());
00193                 return new ArrayType(childType, arraySize == -1 ? 0 : arraySize);
00194             }
00195             else if ((soaWidth & (soaWidth - 1)) != 0) {
00196                 Error(decl->pos, "soa<%d> width illegal.  Value must be power of two.",
00197                       soaWidth);
00198                 return NULL;
00199             }
00200             else if (arraySize != -1 && (arraySize % soaWidth) != 0) {
00201                 Error(decl->pos, "soa<%d> width must evenly divide array size %d.",
00202                       soaWidth, arraySize);
00203                 return NULL;
00204             }
00205             return new SOAArrayType(childStructType, arraySize == -1 ? 0 : arraySize,
00206                                     soaWidth);
00207         }
00208     }
00209 }
00210 
00211 
00212 const Type *
00213 Declarator::GetType(DeclSpecs *ds) const {
00214     bool hasUniformQual = ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM) != 0);
00215     bool hasVaryingQual = ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_VARYING) != 0);
00216     bool isTask =         ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_TASK) != 0);
00217     bool isReference =    ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_REFERENCE) != 0);
00218 
00219     if (hasUniformQual && hasVaryingQual) {
00220         Error(pos, "Can't provide both \"uniform\" and \"varying\" qualifiers.");
00221         return NULL;
00222     }
00223 
00224     if (isFunction) {
00225         std::vector<const Type *> args;
00226         std::vector<std::string> argNames;
00227         if (functionArgs) {
00228             // Loop over the function arguments and get names and types for
00229             // each one in the args and argNames arrays
00230             for (unsigned int i = 0; i < functionArgs->size(); ++i) {
00231                 Declaration *d = (*functionArgs)[i];
00232                 Symbol *sym;
00233                 if (d->declarators.size() == 0) {
00234                     // function declaration like foo(float), w/o a name for
00235                     // the parameter
00236                     char buf[32];
00237                     sprintf(buf, "__anon_parameter_%d", i);
00238                     sym = new Symbol(buf, pos);
00239                     Declarator *declarator = new Declarator(sym, sym->pos);
00240                     sym->type = declarator->GetType(ds);
00241                     d->declarators.push_back(declarator);
00242                 }
00243                 else {
00244                     assert(d->declarators.size() == 1);
00245                     sym = d->declarators[0]->sym;
00246                 }
00247 
00248                 // Arrays are passed by reference, so convert array
00249                 // parameters to be references here.
00250                 if (dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(sym->type) != NULL)
00251                     sym->type = new ReferenceType(sym->type, sym->type->IsConstType());
00252 
00253                 args.push_back(sym->type);
00254                 argNames.push_back(sym->name);
00255             }
00256         }
00257 
00258         if (ds->baseType == NULL) {
00259             Warning(pos, "No return type provided in declaration of function \"%s\". "
00260                     "Treating as \"void\".", sym->name.c_str());
00261             ds->baseType = AtomicType::Void;
00262         }
00263 
00264         if (isReference) {
00265             Error(pos, "Function return types can't be reference types.");
00266             return NULL;
00267         }
00268 
00269         const Type *returnType = lGetType(this, ds, arraySize.begin());
00270         if (returnType == NULL)
00271             return NULL;
00272 
00273         bool isExported = (ds->storageClass == SC_EXPORT);
00274         bool isExternC =  (ds->storageClass == SC_EXTERN_C);
00275         return new FunctionType(returnType, args, pos, &argNames, isTask, 
00276                                 isExported, isExternC);
00277     }
00278     else {
00279         if (isTask)
00280             Error(pos, "\"task\" qualifier illegal in variable declaration \"%s\".",
00281                   sym->name.c_str());
00282 
00283         const Type *type = lGetType(this, ds, arraySize.begin());
00284 
00285         if (type != NULL && isReference) {
00286             bool hasConstQual = ((ds->typeQualifier & TYPEQUAL_CONST) != 0);
00287             type = new ReferenceType(type, hasConstQual);
00288         }
00289 
00290         return type;
00291     }
00292 }

00294 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00295 // Declaration
00296 
00297 void
00298 Declaration::AddSymbols(SymbolTable *st) const {
00299     assert(declSpecs->storageClass != SC_TYPEDEF);
00300 
00301     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < declarators.size(); ++i)
00302        if (declarators[i])
00303            st->AddVariable(declarators[i]->sym);
00304 }
00305 
00306 
00307 void
00308 Declaration::Print() const {
00309     printf("Declaration: specs [");
00310     declSpecs->Print();
00311     printf("], declarators [");
00312     for (unsigned int i = 0 ; i < declarators.size(); ++i) {
00313         declarators[i]->Print();
00314         printf("%s", (i == declarators.size() - 1) ? "]" : ", ");
00315     }
00316 }

00318 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00319 
00320 void
00321 GetStructTypesNamesPositions(const std::vector<StructDeclaration *> &sd,
00322                              std::vector<const Type *> *elementTypes,
00323                              std::vector<std::string> *elementNames,
00324                              std::vector<SourcePos> *elementPositions) {
00325     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < sd.size(); ++i) {
00326         const Type *type = sd[i]->type;
00327         // FIXME: making this fake little DeclSpecs here is really
00328         // disgusting
00329         DeclSpecs ds(type);
00330         if (type->IsUniformType()) 
00331             ds.typeQualifier |= TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM;
00332         else
00333             ds.typeQualifier |= TYPEQUAL_VARYING;
00334 
00335         for (unsigned int j = 0; j < sd[i]->declarators->size(); ++j) {
00336             Declarator *d = (*sd[i]->declarators)[j];
00337             d->InitFromDeclSpecs(&ds);
00338 
00339             // if it's an unsized array, make it a reference to an unsized
00340             // array, so the caller can pass a pointer...
00341             const ArrayType *at = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(d->sym->type);
00342             if (at && at->GetElementCount() == 0)
00343                 d->sym->type = new ReferenceType(d->sym->type, type->IsConstType());
00344 
00345             elementTypes->push_back(d->sym->type);
00346             elementNames->push_back(d->sym->name);
00347             elementPositions->push_back(d->sym->pos);
00348         }
00349     }
00350 }
